info.description: API used for internal customer-facing applications.
info.title: Ping Proxies Private User API

per_page.description: Number of items per page for pagination

get.description: Retrieves a list of Country ISO Codes with their respective details, including alpha codes, calling codes, and subdivisions.
Retrieves geolocation information for a given IP address using the MaxMind service. The response includes both external data provided by MaxMind and internal data derived from internal databases.

parameters.description: IP address for which geolocation information is required
parameters.name: ip_address

internal.description: Internal geolocation data derived from internal databases.

get.description: Retrieves ISO language codes and their corresponding language names.

post.description: Allows a user to create a new API Key for their account. The system limits the number of  active API keys per user. If the maximum number is reached, the user must remove an existing  key before they can generate a new one.

parameters.description: The API Key creation details.
parameters.name: body

items.description: A list containing the ID of the created API key.

api_key_private_key.description: The API key private key string.

api_key_public_key.description: The API key public key string.

message.description: A message indicating the success of the operation.

422.description: Unprocessable Entity - Max API Keys Reached

delete.description: Allows a user to delete an existing API Key associated with their account.  The system sets the status of the API key to "deleted".

parameters.description: ID of the API key to delete.
parameters.name: api_key_id

404.description: Not Found - No API Key with this ID

get.description: Retrieves a specific API Key based on the provided ID for the current user's account.

parameters.description: ID of the API Key to retrieve
parameters.name: api_key_id

get.description: Search API Keys on the customer account using various filters.  Operations including max_, min_ and like_ are supported.

parameters.description: ID of the API key
parameters.name: api_key_id

parameters.description: Status of the API key.
parameters.name: api_key_status

parameters.description: Preview of the API key
parameters.name: api_key_private_key_preview

parameters.description: Scope of the API key
parameters.name: api_key_scope

parameters.description: Label of the API key
parameters.name: api_key_label

parameters.description: Datetime the API key was created
parameters.name: api_key_creation_datetime

parameters.description: Datetime the API key was last updated
parameters.name: api_key_last_update_datetime

get.description: This endpoint analyzes API request data for a given customer over a specified time range and interval. It returns a summary including the total number of requests, errors, and successful requests, broken down by the specified intervals.

parameters.description: Minimum api_request_creation_datetime of the API request
parameters.name: min_api_request_creation_datetime

parameters.description: Maximum api_request_creation_datetime of the API request
parameters.name: max_api_request_creation_datetime

parameters.description: The interval for summarizing analytics. Must be in the format <integer> <unit> where <unit> is one of minute, hour, day. Accepted granulaity is per minute up to one hour, per ten minutes up to 72 hours, per hour up to one week and per day up to one year.
parameters.name: interval

parameters.description: ID of the API request
parameters.name: api_request_id

parameters.description: HTTP method of the API request
parameters.name: api_request_method

parameters.description: Path of the API request
parameters.name: api_request_path

parameters.description: Client IP address of the API request
parameters.name: api_request_client_ip_address

parameters.description: Client user agent of the API request
parameters.name: api_request_client_user_agent

parameters.description: HTTP status code of the API request
parameters.name: api_request_status_code

count.description: The count of intervals analyzed.

intervals.description: Detailed breakdown of requests, errors, and successful responses for each interval.

total_error.description: The total number of error responses in the given period.

total_requests.description: The total number of API requests in the given period.

total_successful.description: The total number of successful responses in the given period.

parameters.name: api_request_id

parameters.description: HTTP status code of the API request
parameters.name: api_request_status_code

parameters.description: Minimum api_request_creation_datetime of the API request
parameters.name: min_api_request_creation_datetime

parameters.description: Maximum api_request_creation_datetime of the API request
parameters.name: max_api_request_creation_datetime

parameters.description: Reason for the Balance Transaction

post.description: This endpoint takes the provided cart items and an optional promotional code, then calculates the total cost. It handles the application of any discounts from promotions, calculates the total considering the user's credit balance, and returns a detailed summary of the pricing. The user authentication is optional; if the user is  authenticated, the credit balance from their account will be considered in the calculation.

parameters.description: The cart items and optional promotional code for which to calculate the total cost.
parameters.name: body

is_top_up.description: Indicates whether the cart is a top-up cart. If true, the top_up_amount parameter must be provided. Other parameters are restricted if declared, for example, line_items and promotional_code.

line_items.description: List of items in the cart, where each item is represented as a dictionary containing  'item_price_id' and 'item_quantity'. This parameter is required for the calculation.

item_price_id.description: ID of the price associated with the product.

item_quantity.description: Quantity of the product to be purchased.

promotional_code.description: Promotional code to apply to the cart. This parameter can not be used if is_top_up is true.

top_up_amount.description: The amount to top up the user's credit balance by. This parameter is required if is_top_up is true.

validate_payment_platform.description: If the list of available checkout payment platforms is validated against this specific cart and customer. This should be used at the final stage of checkout as it increases response times.

parameters.description: Content type for the request body as application/json.
parameters.name: Content-Type

200.description: Successfully verified the cart and calculated the pricing.

allowed_coinpayments_currencies.description: List of allowed currencies for coin payments.

allowed_payment_platforms.description: List of allowed payment platforms like Stripe, Bitpay.

allowed_saved_payment_methods.description: List of allowed saved payment methods with details.

credit_only_checkout.description: Indicates if the checkout is credit only.

customer_credit_balance_applied.description: Indicates if the user's credit balance was used.

disallowed_coinpayments_currencies.description: List of disallowed currencies with reasons.

disallowed_payment_platforms.description: List of disallowed payment platforms with reasons.

discounted.description: Indicates if a discount was applied.

invalid_reason.description: The reason for the cart being invalid. Only set if is_valid is false.

is_top_up.description: Indicates if the cart is for a top-up.

is_valid.description: Indicates if the cart is valid to checkout. This is used when the contents of the cart is logically correct but the cart is not valid for checkout, for example, if the cart is under the minimum store order value.

item_country_id.description: Country code associated with the item.

item_per_unit_amount.description: Cost per unit of the item.

item_price_id.description: Unique identifier for the item's price.

item_quantity.description: Quantity of the item in the cart.

item_type.description: Type or category of the item.

promotional_code_id.description: ID of the applied promotional code, if any.

total.description: Total cost after discounts, before credit.

total_after_applied_credit.description: Total cost after discounts and credit.

400.description: Bad request. One or more parameters were missing or invalid.

422.description: Unprocessable Entity. The provided data is not valid for creating a checkout.

post.description: This endpoint creates a checkout for the authenticated user based on the provided data. It supports  different payment platforms, promotional codes, and can handle both one-time and recurring payments.

parameters.description: The data needed to create the checkout.
parameters.name: body

coinpayments_currency.description: Cryptocurrency to use for the checkout. Only applicable for if payment_platform=coinpayments.

is_top_up.description: Indicates whether the checkout is for topping up the customer credit balance.

line_items.description: List of items for the checkout, where each item is represented as a dictionary containing  'item_price_id' and 'item_quantity'. Required for if is_top_up=False.

item_price_id.description: ID of the price associated with the product.

item_quantity.description: Quantity of the product to be purchased.

payment_method_id.description: ID of a saved payment method to use for the payment. Usually, used for a saved Stripe card. When using, payment_platform must match the saved payment methods platform.

payment_platform.description: The payment platform to use for the checkout.

promotional_code.description: Promotional code to apply to the checkout.

top_up_amount.description: Intger amount to top up in cent if is_top_up is set to true. Must be between $5-10,000 (500-1000000 cents).

parameters.description: Content type for the request body as application/json.
parameters.name: Content-Type

external_payment_id.description: ID of the payment in the external system, if applicable.

invoice_is_paid.description: Indicates whether the invoice is already paid. Use this to decide whether to redirect the user to the payment URL or not.

redirect_url.description: URL where the user should be redirected to complete the payment.

400.description: Bad request. One or more parameters were missing or invalid.

422.description: Unprocessable Entity. The provided data is not valid for creating a checkout.

parameters.name: country_name

patch.description: Allows authenticated users to edit their customer details.  Changes to email address, password, or enabling email two-factor authentication require an additional  two-factor authentication step. Ensure that the appropriate fields are provided in the request body.

parameters.description: The customer details to be edited.
parameters.name: body

customer_billing_line_one.description: First line of the customer billing address.

customer_billing_line_two.description: Second line of the customer billing address (optional).

customer_billing_subdivision_name.description: State, province, or other subdivision name of the customer billing address.

customer_billing_zip_code.description: Postal or ZIP code of the customer billing address.

customer_email_address.description: New email address of the customer. Changing this requires two-factor authentication.

customer_email_two_factor_authentication.description: Enable or disable email-based two-factor authentication. Altering this requires two-factor authentication.

customer_password.description: New password of the customer. Changing this requires two-factor authentication.

customer_profile_image_url.description: URL of the customer profile image.

two_factor_authentication_private_key.description: Required if prompted by the API. Private 2FA key provided by the customer and sent to them via email or SMS. [Conditional]

two_factor_authentication_public_key.description: Required if prompted by the API. Public 2FA key provided by the API when prompted for 2FA by the API. [Conditional]

parameters.description: Content type for the request body as application/json.
parameters.name: Content-Type

edited.description: List of Customer IDs that were successfully edited.

message.description: Success message indicating the customer details were edited.

post.description: Allows customers to login using their email address and password.  If the account has two-factor authentication enabled, a 499 response will be returned indicating that two-factor authentication is required. Ensure that the required fields are provided in the request body.

parameters.description: The customer login credentials.
parameters.name: body

two_factor_authentication_private_key.description: Required if prompted by the API. Private 2FA key provided by the customer and sent to them via email or SMS. [Conditional]

two_factor_authentication_public_key.description: Required if prompted by the API. Public 2FA key provided by the API when prompted for 2FA by the API. [Conditional]

parameters.description: Content type for the request body as application/json.
parameters.name: Content-Type

access_token.description: JWT access token for authenticated sessions.

message.description: Success message indicating the login was successful.

401.description: Unauthorized access. Possible reasons include incorrect credentials or no account exists.

post.description: Logs out the authenticated customer from the current session. This won't affect other devices or sessions. The JWT cookies associated with the session are unset, ensuring that the customer is logged out from the current device or session.

message.description: Success message indicating the logout was successful for the current session.

401.description: Unauthorized access. Please login to access this route.

post.description: Logs out the authenticated customer from all devices by regenerating the session key. This ensures the customer is logged out everywhere.

application/json.message: Customer successfully logged out of all devices.

message.description: Success message indicating the logout was successful from all devices.
message.example: Customer successfully logged out of all devices.

401.description: Unauthorized access. Please login to access this route.

get.description: This endpoint retrieves the OAuth authorization URL based on the external service (e.g., Google) and the specified authorization type (login, connect, signup). Instead of directly redirecting,  it returns the URL so that the client application can handle the redirection as needed.

parameters.description: The name of the external OAuth service.
parameters.name: external_service

parameters.description: Type of OAuth action
parameters.name: authorization_type

400.description: Invalid parameters or unsupported external service/authorization type.

post.description: This endpoint allows the disconnection of a linked Google OAuth account from the customer Ping Proxies account.  After invoking this function, the customer linked Google OAuth id will be set to None in the database.  Important api logging events are generated, and a notification is created for the customer.

external_service.description: The name of the external OAuth service

401.description: Unauthorized access due to incorrect credentials or no account exists.

post.description: Allows customers to reset their password using their email address.  The endpoint checks for potential brute-force attacks and two-factor authentication (if enabled). After successful password reset, the customer is logged in and a notification is generated. Ensure  that the required fields are provided in the request body.

parameters.description: The customer password reset credentials.
parameters.name: body

two_factor_authentication_private_key.description: Required if prompted by the API. Private 2FA key provided by the customer and sent to them via email or SMS.

two_factor_authentication_public_key.description: Required if prompted by the API. Public 2FA key provided by the API when prompted for 2FA by the API.

parameters.description: Content type for the request body as application/json.
parameters.name: Content-Type

200.description: Password Reset Successful & Customer Logged In

application/json.message: Password reset successful. You are now logged in.

access_token.description: JWT access token for authenticated sessions.

message.description: Success message indicating the password reset and login were successful.
message.example: Password reset successful. You are now logged in.

401.description: Unauthorized access due to incorrect credentials or no account exists.

403.description: Forbidden - Customer is suspended or repeated failed attempts detected.

get.description: Retrieves the profile of the currently authenticated customer, along with their credit balance.

post.description: Security lock customer with security key and customer_id.

parameters.description: ID of the customer to security lock
parameters.name: customer_id

parameters.description: Security Key Information
parameters.name: body

post.description: Register a new customer account using their first name, last name, email address, and password. Additionally, allows for optional parameters such as phone number, profile image URL, two-factor authentication settings, country code, and language code. After registration, a two-factor authentication step is checked and an email  notification is sent to the newly registered customer.

parameters.description: The customer registration details.
parameters.name: body

customer_billing_line_one.description: First line of the customer billing address.

customer_billing_line_two.description: Second line of the customer billing address (optional).

customer_billing_subdivision_name.description: State, province, or other subdivision name of the customer billing address.

customer_billing_zip_code.description: Postal or ZIP code of the customer billing address.

customer_email_two_factor_authentication.description: Flag indicating if email two-factor authentication is enabled.

customer_profile_image_url.description: Profile image URL of the customer.

two_factor_authentication_private_key.description: Required if prompted by the API. Private 2FA key provided by the customer and sent to them via email or SMS. [Conditional]

two_factor_authentication_public_key.description: Required if prompted by the API. Public 2FA key provided by the API when prompted for 2FA by the API. [Conditional]

parameters.description: Content type for the request body as application/json.
parameters.name: Content-Type

access_token.description: JWT access token for authenticated sessions.

message.description: Success message indicating the registration and login were successful.
message.example: Registration successful. You are now logged in.

post.description: Allows a customer to retrieve the payment URL for a specified invoice using different payment platforms.  Depending on the chosen payment platform, the function can return a Stripe hosted URL or a Bitpay invoice URL.  Ensure the required fields are provided in the request body.

parameters.description: ID of the invoice to pay.
parameters.name: invoice_id

parameters.description: The invoice details and payment platform choice.
parameters.name: body

coinpayments_currency.description: Cryptocurrency to use for the checkout. Only applicable for if payment_platform is coinpayments.

payment_method_id.description: ID of a saved payment method to use for the payment. Usually, used for a saved Stripe card. When using, payment_platform must match the saved payment methods platform.

payment_platform.description: The payment platform to be used for the payment.

parameters.description: Content type for the request body as application/json.
parameters.name: Content-Type

external_payment_id.description: External payment ID, mainly used for Bitpay / Coinpayments.

invoice_is_paid.description: Indicates whether the invoice is already paid. Use this to decide whether to redirect the user to the payment URL or not.

redirect_url.description: The payment URL where the user can complete the payment.

edited.description: List of Invoice IDs that were successfully edited.

message.description: Success message indicating that the payment URL was created.

422.description: Unprocessable Entity - Either the invoice is not payable or it's not open.

get.description: Allows a customer to retrieve the payment options for an open invoice.  Will return a list of off playform options along with saved payment methods as well as disallowed options with the reason they are not available for the invoice.

parameters.description: ID of the Invoice to retrieve
parameters.name: invoice_id

parameters.description: Content type for the request body as application/json.
parameters.name: Content-Type

allowed_coinpayments_currencies.description: List of allowed currencies for coin payments.

allowed_payment_platforms.description: List of allowed payment platforms like Stripe, Bitpay.

allowed_saved_payment_methods.description: List of allowed saved payment methods with details.

disallowed_coinpayments_currencies.description: List of disallowed currencies with reasons.

disallowed_payment_platforms.description: List of disallowed payment platforms with reasons.

message.description: Success message indicating that payment options were verified.

422.description: Unprocessable Entity - Either the invoice is not payable or it's not open.

post.description: Allows a customer to release an invoice cart, thereby voiding the invoice. This operation might be necessary if the invoice is no longer required or valid. This function works mainly with Stripe invoices. If the invoice is associated with a subscription, the subscription is canceled. If not, the invoice is voided.

parameters.description: ID of the invoice to release.
parameters.name: invoice_id

parameters.description: Content type for the request body as application/json.
parameters.name: Content-Type

edited.description: List of Invoice IDs that were successfully released and voided.

message.description: Success message indicating that the invoice cart was released.

422.description: Unprocessable Entity - Either the invoice cart couldn't be retrieved or it's not open.

get.description: Retrieves a specific Invoice based on the provided ID for the current user's account.  Additional details like transactions and balance transactions can also be fetched based on query parameters.

parameters.description: ID of the Invoice to retrieve
parameters.name: invoice_id

get.description: Search Invoices on the customer account using various filters.  Operations including max_, min_ and like_ are supported.

parameters.description: ID of the Invoice
parameters.name: invoice_id

parameters.description: Amount paid for the Invoice
parameters.name: invoice_amount_paid

parameters.description: Total amount of the Invoice
parameters.name: invoice_total

parameters.description: Discounts applied to the Invoice
parameters.name: invoice_discounts

parameters.description: Due datetime for the Invoice
parameters.name: invoice_due_datetime

parameters.description: Status of the Invoice
parameters.name: invoice_status

parameters.description: Type of the Invoice
parameters.name: invoice_type

parameters.description: Service ID associated with the Invoice
parameters.name: service_id

parameters.description: Whether the Invoice has automatic collection enabled
parameters.name: invoice_is_automatic_collection

parameters.description: Whether the Invoice is a cart
parameters.name: invoice_is_cart

parameters.description: PDF associated with the Invoice
parameters.name: invoice_pdf

parameters.description: URL of the Invoice
parameters.name: invoice_url

parameters.description: Datetime the Invoice was created
parameters.name: invoice_creation_datetime

parameters.description: Datetime the Invoice was last updated
parameters.name: invoice_last_update_datetime

get.description: This endpoint analyzes logs for a given customer within a specified time range and interval. It provides a summary including total bytes, total number of requests, errors, and successful requests, segmented by the specified intervals. The analysis can be done on immediate log data or log summaries, depending on the retention period.

parameters.description: The minimum datetime for the creation of logs to consider in the analysis.
parameters.name: min_log_creation_datetime

parameters.description: The maximum datetime for the creation of logs to consider in the analysis.
parameters.name: max_log_creation_datetime

parameters.description: The interval for summarizing analytics. Must be in the format <integer> <unit> where <unit> is one of minute, hour, day. Accepted granulaity is per minute up to one hour, per ten minutes up to 72 hours, per hour up to one week and per day up to one year.
parameters.name: interval

parameters.description: Network type of the Log
parameters.name: log_network

parameters.description: Domain associated with the Log
parameters.name: log_domain

parameters.description: ID of the associated Proxy User
parameters.name: proxy_user_id

count.description: The count of intervals analyzed.

intervals.description: Detailed breakdown of bytes, requests, errors, and successful logs for each interval.

total_bytes.description: The total number of bytes logged in the given period.

total_error.description: The total number of error logs in the given period.

total_requests.description: The total number of log requests in the given period.

total_successful.description: The total number of successful log entries in the given period.

delete.description: Allows a user to delete an existing payment method associated with their account.  Payment methods that are attached to service subscriptions can not be deleted until they are removed from such subscriptions.

404.description: Not Found - Payment Method not found

get.description: This endpoint retrieves a list of proxies assigned to the current user based on the specified proxy IDs. It supports filtering and returning proxies in different formats, protocols, and IP versions. The list of proxies can be customized to include different authorization types and can be returned in a user-friendly format according to the user's needs.

parameters.name: list_protocol

parameters.description: IP version preference.
parameters.name: list_version

parameters.description: Desired format for displaying the proxies in the returned list.
parameters.name: list_format

parameters.description: ID of the proxy_user used for authentication with the proxies.
parameters.name: proxy_user_id

parameters.description: Authentication type for the proxies in the returned list.
parameters.name: list_authentication

400.description: Bad request due to invalid parameters.

422.description: Unprocessable Entity

post.description:
This endpoint allows for the creation of a new proxy user. The username and password  are either provided or randomly generated if not provided, and other configurations  are set based on the provided parameters.
A proxy user can have strict security, restricted services, and IP address authorizations,  and these configurations can be set during the creation of the proxy user.
The restrictions and validations in place ensure the integrity and security of each proxy  user created, considering various scenarios such as existing IP addresses, username restrictions,  and service statuses.

parameters.description: The details of the proxy user to be created.
parameters.name: body

ip_address_authentications.description: List of IP addresses authenticated for the proxy user.

proxy_user_id.description: The ID of the proxy user. It's alphanumeric and up to 16 characters.

proxy_user_is_strict_security.description: Indicates whether strict security is enabled for the proxy user.

proxy_user_password.description: The password of the proxy user. It's alphanumeric and up to 16 characters.

proxy_user_residential_limit.description: The residential proxy limit for the proxy user in bytes.

restricted_service_ids.description: List of restricted service_ids for the proxy user.

parameters.description: Content type for the request body as application/json.
parameters.name: Content-Type

items.description: A list containing the ID of the created API key.

message.description: A message indicating the success of the operation.

409.description: Conflict - Existing Proxy User/ IP address

422.description: Unprocessable Entity - Inactive Service / Proxy User limit exceeded

delete.description: Allows a user to delete an existing proxy user associated with their account. Proxy users that are set as account default can not be deleted,  and already deleted proxy users can not be deleted again.

parameters.description: ID of the proxy user record to delete.
parameters.name: proxy_user_id

404.description: Not Found - No Proxy User with this ID

422.description: Unprocessable Entity - Proxy User is already deleted or is account default

patch.description: This endpoint allows a user to edit an existing Proxy User entry by providing the necessary proxy_user_id.  Various properties like password, strict security setting, restricted services, and IP Address authentications can be updated.

parameters.description: ID of the proxy user record to edit.
parameters.name: proxy_user_id

parameters.description: The Proxy User details to be edited.
parameters.name: body

ip_address_authentications.description: The list of IP addresses that are authenticated to use the Proxy User.

proxy_user_is_strict_security.description: The new strict security setting for the Proxy User.

proxy_user_password.description: The new password for the Proxy User. Must be an alphanumeric string up to 16 characters.

proxy_user_residential_limit.description: The new residential limit for the Proxy User.

restricted_service_ids.description: The list of Service IDs to which access should be restricted.

parameters.description: Content type for the request body as application/json.
parameters.name: Content-Type

edited.description: List of Proxy User IDs that were successfully edited.

message.description: Success message indicating the Proxy User was edited.

404.description: Proxy User or Service Not Found

422.description: Unprocessable Entity

delete.description: Allows the authenticated user to cancel a specific service associated with their account. The user provides a service_id and optionally a cancel feedback and comment.

parameters.description: ID of the Service to cancel
parameters.name: service_id

parameters.description: Service cancellation details.
parameters.name: body

cancel_comment.description: A short comment explaining the reason for cancellation. Maximum 300 characters.

cancel_feedback.description: Feedback code indicating the cancellation reason.

parameters.description: Content type for the request body as application/json.
parameters.name: Content-Type

edited.description: List of service IDs that were successfully canceled.

message.description: Success message indicating the successful cancellation of the service.

proxy_edited.description: List of proxy IDs that were affected by the cancellation of the service.

400.description: Bad request due to invalid parameters.

422.description: Invalid or unprocessable request due to inconsistency between parameters or service is not active.

patch.description: Allows a user to edit the details of an existing service.  This can include changes in payment method, adjusting automatic collection,  and marking for cancellation at the end of a period.

parameters.description: ID of the Service to edit
parameters.name: service_id

parameters.description: Parameters required to edit the service.
parameters.name: body

service_is_automatic_collection.description: Flag to determine if service charge should be automatic.

service_is_pending_cancellation.description: Indicates if the service should be canceled at the end of the period.

parameters.description: Content type for the request body as application/json.
parameters.name: Content-Type

edited.description: List of service IDs that were successfully edited.

400.description: Bad request due to invalid parameters.

404.description: Service or Payment Method not found.

422.description: Invalid request due to service status or other conditions.

post.description: This endpoint allows an authenticated user to reconfigure an existing service associated with their account. The user provides a service_id along with new configuration parameters such as price ID, quantity, and whether the changes should apply at the end of the billing period. The function validates the input, applies the changes, and commits them to the database. It also sends a notification email to the user about the service reconfiguration.

parameters.description: ID of the Service to be reconfigured
parameters.name: service_id

parameters.description: New configuration details for the service.
parameters.name: body

end_of_period.description: Indicates if changes apply at the end of the billing period.

remove_proxy_ids.description: List of proxy IDs to be removed as part of the reconfiguration.

service_price_id.description: New service price ID for reconfiguration.

edited.description: List of service IDs that were successfully reconfigured.

message.description: Confirmation message of successful service reconfiguration.
message.example: Service successfully reconfigured with price_id price_1OCM6DFKo7UQ3XWIPqdvUFuJ and quantity 20.

201.description: Service reconfigured and subscription schedule created for changes to apply at the end of the billing period.

edited.description: List of service IDs that were successfully reconfigured.

message.description: Confirmation message including details of the subscription schedule created.

subscription_schedule_created.description: List of subscription schedule IDs created for the reconfiguration.

400.description: Bad request due to invalid parameters.

422.description: Unprocessable request due to invalid reconfiguration parameters.

post.description: Allows the authenticated user to calculate the details for reconfiguring a specific service associated with their account. The user provides a service_id and reconfiguration parameters such as service price ID, service quantity, end of period flag, and proxy IDs to remove. The system validates and calculates the new configuration, returning details like new price, quantity, and total cost.

parameters.description: ID of the Service to reconfigure
parameters.name: service_id

parameters.description: Reconfiguration details for the service.
parameters.name: body

end_of_period.description: Flag to indicate if the reconfiguration should apply at the end of the current billing period.

remove_proxy_ids.description: List of proxy IDs to be removed as part of the reconfiguration.

service_price_id.description: The new service price ID for the reconfiguration.

service_quantity.description: The new service quantity for the reconfiguration.

200.description: Successfully calculated the service reconfiguration details.

anchor_behavior.description: Specifies the behavior of the anchor for the reconfiguration.

due.description: Specifies when the reconfiguration takes effect.

end_of_period.description: Indicates if the reconfiguration applies at the end of the current billing period.

message.description: Success message indicating the successful calculation of reconfiguration.
message.example: Service reconfiguration option validated and calculated.

proration_behavior.description: Specifies the proration behavior for the reconfiguration.

service_price_id.description: The new service price ID resulting from the reconfiguration.

service_quantity.description: The new service quantity resulting from the reconfiguration.

total.description: The total cost resulting from the reconfiguration.

400.description: Bad request due to invalid parameters.

422.description: Unprocessable request due to invalid reconfiguration parameters.

post.summary: Calculate Reconfiguration Details for a Service

get.description: Enables the authenticated user to view available reconfiguration options for a specific service associated with their account. The user provides a service_id, and the system returns a list of possible reconfiguration options based on the service type, status, and other parameters.

parameters.description: ID of the Service for which to retrieve reconfigure options
parameters.name: service_id

200.description: Successfully retrieved the list of reconfigure options.

message.description: Success message indicating the retrieval of reconfigure options.
message.example: Service reconfigure option list successfully generated.

reconfigure_option.description: List of available reconfiguration options for the service.

end_of_period.description: Indicates if the reconfiguration applies at the end of the current billing period.

max_service_quantity.description: Maximum service quantity available for reconfiguration.

min_service_quantity.description: Minimum service quantity required for reconfiguration.

product_prices.description: List of product prices applicable for reconfiguration.

items.description: Detailed information about each product price.

require_remove_proxy_ids.description: Indicates if proxy ID removal is required for the reconfiguration.

400.description: Bad request due to invalid parameters.

404.description: Service or current product not found.

422.description: Service cannot be reconfigured due to its current status, lack of a subscription, or presence of a subscription schedule.

get.summary: Retrieve Reconfigure Options for a Service

get.description: Retrieves a specific Service based on the provided ID for the current user's account.  If the 'show_proxies' parameter is set to 'True', it will also fetch proxies associated  with each service and add them to the result.

parameters.description: ID of the Service to retrieve
parameters.name: service_id

parameters.description: If the proxies associated with the service should be returned
parameters.name: proxies

get.description: Search Services on the customer account using various filters. Operations including max_, min_ and like_ are supported.

parameters.description: ID of the service
parameters.name: service_id

parameters.description: Current status of the service
parameters.name: service_status

parameters.description: Name of the service
parameters.name: service_name

parameters.description: Type of the service
parameters.name: service_type

parameters.description: Protocol of the service
parameters.name: service_protocol

parameters.description: Quantity of the service
parameters.name: service_quantity

parameters.description: Payment method ID of the service
parameters.name: payment_method_id

parameters.description: Total amount of the service
parameters.name: service_total

parameters.description: Service cycle (e.g., "1:month")
parameters.name: service_cycle

parameters.description: Datetime the service was dispatched
parameters.name: service_dispatch_datetime

parameters.description: Datetime the service will expire
parameters.name: service_expiry_datetime

parameters.description: URL of the service image
parameters.name: service_image

parameters.description: If the service is set for automatic collection
parameters.name: service_is_automatic_collection

parameters.description: If the service is pending cancellation
parameters.name: service_is_pending_cancellation

parameters.description: ISO Country Code [(ISO 3166-1 alpha-2)](https://www.iban.com/country-codes)
parameters.name: country_id

parameters.description: Price ID of the service
parameters.name: service_price_id

parameters.description: Product ID of the service
parameters.name: product_id

parameters.description: Promotional code of the service
parameters.name: service_promotional_code

parameters.description: Subscription ID of the service
parameters.name: service_subscription_id

parameters.description: Datetime the service was created
parameters.name: service_creation_datetime

parameters.description: Datetime the service was last updated
parameters.name: service_last_update_datetime

parameters.description: If the proxies associated with the service should be returned
parameters.name: proxies

get.description: Retrieves a specific Service Adjustment based on the provided ID for the current user's account.  The returned adjustment provides details about any modifications or updates made to the user's service.

parameters.description: ID of the Service Adjustment to retrieve
parameters.name: service_adjustment_id

get.description: Search Service Adjustments on the customer account using various filters.  Operations including max_, min_ and like_ are supported.

parameters.description: ID of the invoice
parameters.name: invoice_id

parameters.description: Service ID associated with the service adjustment
parameters.name: service_id

parameters.description: ID of the service adjustment
parameters.name: service_adjustment_id

parameters.description: Type of the service adjustment
parameters.name: service_adjustment_type

parameters.description: Current status of the service adjustment
parameters.name: service_adjustment_status

parameters.description: Whether the adjustment was made by an administrator
parameters.name: service_adjustment_is_administrator

parameters.description: Whether the adjustment was made automatically
parameters.name: service_adjustment_is_automatic

parameters.description: Whether the adjustment was made by a customer
parameters.name: service_adjustment_is_customer

parameters.description: Datetime the service adjustment was created
parameters.name: service_adjustment_creation_datetime

parameters.description: Datetime the service adjustment was last updated
parameters.name: service_adjustment_last_update_datetime

get.description: Retrieves a specific Subdivision.

parameters.description: ID of the Subdivision to retrieve
parameters.name: subdivision_id

get.description: Search Subdivision entries using various filters. This endpoint allows users to query subdivisions based on specific attributes.

parameters.description: Unique identifier of the Subdivision
parameters.name: subdivision_id

parameters.description: Name of the Subdivision
parameters.name: subdivision_name

parameters.description: Country identifier to which the Subdivision belongs
parameters.name: country_id

parameters.description: Alias or alternative name for the Subdivision
parameters.name: subdivision_alias

delete.description: Allows a user to delete an existing Subscription Schedule associated with their account.  The system sets the status of the Subscription Schedule to "deleted".

parameters.description: ID of the Subscription Schedule to delete.
parameters.name: subscription_schedule_id

404.description: Not Found - No Subscription Schedule with this ID

get.description: Retrieves a specific Subscription Schedule based on the provided ID for the current user's account.

parameters.description: ID of the Subscription Schedule to retrieve
parameters.name: subscription_schedule_id

get.description: Search subscription schedule entries on the customer account using various filters, including details from associated service subscriptions. Operations including max_, min_ and like_ are supported.

parameters.description: ID of the Subscription Schedule
parameters.name: subscription_schedule_id

parameters.description: ID of the associated Service Subscription
parameters.name: service_subscription_id

parameters.description: Type of the Subscription Schedule
parameters.name: subscription_schedule_type

parameters.description: Status of the Subscription Schedule
parameters.name: subscription_schedule_status

get.description: Retrieves a specific Transaction based on the provided ID for the current user's account.  Provides details about any specific financial or data movement associated with the user's account.

parameters.description: ID of the Transaction to retrieve
parameters.name: transaction_id

get.description: Search Transactions on the customer account using various filters.  Operations including max_, min_ and like_ are supported.

parameters.description: ID of the Transaction
parameters.name: transaction_id

parameters.description: ID of the associated Invoice
parameters.name: invoice_id

parameters.description: Status of the Transaction
parameters.name: transaction_status

parameters.description: Amount of the Transaction
parameters.name: transaction_amount

parameters.description: Reason for Transaction refund, if applicable
parameters.name: transaction_refund_reason

parameters.description: Method used for the Transaction (e.g., cryptocurrency)
parameters.name: transaction_method

parameters.description: Processor used for the Transaction
parameters.name: transaction_processor

parameters.description: Currency of the Transaction (e.g., XRP)
parameters.name: transaction_currency

parameters.description: Datetime the Transaction was created
parameters.name: transaction_creation_datetime

parameters.description: Datetime the Transaction was last updated
parameters.name: transaction_last_update_datetime

post.description: This endpoint takes various components of an address, such as address lines, subdivision name,  ISO country code, and zip code, then returns a geocoded address. The geocoded address includes  formatted components and the full address in a structured format. The address_line_two field is

parameters.description: The components of the address to be geocoded.
parameters.name: body

address_line_one.description: The first line of the address, typically containing the street and number.

address_line_two.description: The second line of the address, if applicable.

zip_code.description: The postal or zip code for the address.

parameters.description: Content type for the request body as application/json.
parameters.name: Content-Type

200.description: Successfully geocoded the address and returned the formatted data.

address_line_one.description: The first line of the geocoded address.

address_line_two.description: The second line of the geocoded address, if applicable.

country_id.description: The ISO country code of the geocoded address.

subdivision_name.description: The subdivision name of the geocoded address (e.g., city or locality).

zip_code.description: The postal or zip code of the geocoded address.

400.description: Bad request. One or more parameters were missing or invalid.

APIPrivateKey.description: Private API key for user-level authentication.
APIPrivateKey.name: X-API-Private-Key

APIPublicKey.description: Public API key for user-level authentication.
APIPublicKey.name: X-API-Public-Key

ApplicationAPIPrivateKey.description: Private API key for application-level authentication.
ApplicationAPIPrivateKey.name: X-Application-API-Private-Key

ApplicationAPIPublicKey.description: Public API key for application-level authentication.
ApplicationAPIPublicKey.name: X-Application-API-Public-Key

BearerAuth.description: JWT token provided in the 'Authorization' header for customer-level authentication. Format as: Bearer [token]
BearerAuth.name: Authorization

CookieAuth.description: JWT token stored in a cookie named 'access_token_cookie' for customer-level authentication.
CookieAuth.name: access_token_cookie

ProxyHostserverAPIAuthenticationKey.description: Authentication API key for specific ProxyHostserver.
ProxyHostserverAPIAuthenticationKey.name: X-ProxyHostserver-API-Authentication-Key
